title: Plave (band)
text:
Plave (Korean: 플레이브; stylized in all caps) is a South Korean virtual boy band formed by Vlast. The group consists of five members: Yejun, Noah, Hamin, Eunho, and Bamby.


== Name ==
The group name "Plave" is a compound word combining Play + Rêve (Dream), symbolising their worldview of creating a new space to achieve their dreams.


== History ==


=== 2022–2023: Introduction and official debut ===
Plave was released through a live broadcast on its official YouTube and Twitch on September 15, 2022. The group made their official debut on March 12, 2023, with the release of their first single album Asterum, a mysterious space that exists between Caelum and Terra where they meet their fans, according to Plave's worldview.
The group's second EP, Asterum: The Shape of Things to Come reached one million streams in 13 hours, and a total of 1.7 million streams in 24 hours after its release and entered the Melon Hall of Fame. On November 17, 2023, it was announced that the group was nominated for Rookie of the Year at the Melon Music Awards.
During their livestream on December 12th, 2023, the members announced that they will be joining Weverse, subsequently opening an official fan club membership through the application at the start of 2024. Plave is the first virtual group to join the platform.


=== 2024–present: First anniversary and fan concert ===
On February 26, 2024, their second mini album Asterum: 134-1 was released, which sold 221,151 physical albums on opening day and 569,289 copies in one week, a new record for the group. Their title track "Way 4 Luv" won first place on two Korean weekly music shows, Show Champion, and Show! Music Core, making them the first virtual idol group in history to win the awards.
Plave celebrated their debut anniversary on March 12, 2024, with a livestream on their YouTube channel gaining over 35,000 live viewers from all over the world. In celebration of their first anniversary, a pop-up store themed around their song "Way 4 Luv" was opened for two weeks at the start of March 2024 at The Hyundai Seoul, South Korea. 
They held their first fan concert over April 13–14, 2024 at the Olympic Hall, Seoul, South Korea.


== Members ==
Yejun (예준) – leader, vocalist, producer
Noah (노아) – vocalist, producer
Hamin (하민) – rapper, dancer, choreographer
Eunho (은호) – rapper, vocalist, producer
Bamby (밤비) – vocalist, dancer, choreographer
